title: Humiliating trade for $95m quarterback
text:
Houston Texans trade $95 million underperforming QB Brock Osweiler for practically nothing to Cleveland March 10, 2017 9:57am Source: FOX SPORTS THE Houston Texans have had enough of Brock Osweiler as their quarterback. 
A year after signing Osweiler to a four-year, $95 million ($US72 million) contract, the Texans dealt the 26-year-old and a second-round pick in 2018 to the Cleveland Browns in return for a fourth-round pick. 
That’s right, in order to get the NFL’s worst team to assume the guaranteed remainder of Osweiler’s multi-million-dollar contract, the Texans had to give up a second-round draft pick. 
And according to recent reports, the Browns don’t plan on keeping him either, eyeing a possible trade option instead. OFFICIAL: The #Texans have traded QB Brock Osweiler to the Cleveland Browns. — Houston Texans (@HoustonTexans) March 9, 2017 The #Browns are planning on cutting Brock Osweiler, source said. Of course, if someone will trade for him… — Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) March 9, 2017 Teams already have reached out to Browns to inquire about Brock Osweiler's availability, per team sources. — Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) March 9, 2017 The #Browns are seriously getting calls about Brock Osweiler.Seriously. — Benjamin Allbright (@AllbrightNFL) March 9, 2017 
Osweiler had a rocky season in his first year as a starter, completing 59 per cent of his passes while throwing 15 touchdowns and 16 interceptions. 
He was benched late in the season and regained his starting spot when backup Texans QB Tom Savage suffered an injury. 
Osweiler didn’t take advantage of the opportunity when he was reinserted as starter, completing 57 per cent of his attempts while throwing two touchdowns to three interceptions. Former Houston Texans quarterback Brock Osweiler. Source: AP 
Osweiler spent his first four seasons with the Broncos after Denver drafted him in the second round in 2012. He was mainly the backup until 2015, when he started seven games for an injured Peyton Manning, leading the Broncos to a 5-2 mark while throwing 10 touchdowns to six interceptions in that span. 3/9/16: Osweiler signs $72 mil. contract with Texans3/9/17: Osweiler and 2nd round pick traded to Browns — Andrew Siciliano (@AndrewSiciliano) March 9, 2017 The #Browns draft picks after the Osweiler trade:2017: 1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 5, 5, 6, 62018: 1, 2, 2, 2, 3, 4, 4, 5, 6, 6, 7 — NFL GameDay (@NFLGameDay) March 9, 2017 
Manning retired shortly after the Broncos won the Super Bowl, paving the way for Osweiler to take over. But the Texans rolled the dice and gave Osweiler that four-year deal that included $37 million guaranteed. 
The trade also could mean the end of Robert Griffin III’s time with the Browns, who might try to trade the veteran quarterback or see if he’s willing to be a backup. Looks like Osweiler's stint in Cleveland will last about 49 seconds longer than Andrew Bogut's.
